content:
Dear Khalid,

I hope this message finds you well. I'm writing to inform you that I will need to push my start date back by one month. I apologize for any inconvenience this may cause, and I appreciate your understanding in this matter.

I'm still in the process of obtaining the necessary documents to leave Ukraine for extended periods of time. While I thought I had everything I needed, I encountered an issue with Ukrainian border control on Feb 23 and have since applied for additional documents. Unfortunately, the officials have informed me that it may take up to a month to obtain these documents due to the current situation, as regulations on this topic are subject to frequent change.

I want to assure you that I am working diligently to obtain the necessary documentation as soon as possible. However, it's not 100% guaranteed that I will be able to leave Ukraine even once the new documents are ready. I will notify my current employer of my leave only once I have safely left the country. As a result, my start date will likely be around May 2, taking into account the one-month notice period.

Thank you for your patience and understanding in this matter. Please let me know if there is anything else you need from me during this time. I'm looking forward to joining the team at our new company soon.

Best regards,

[Your Name]
